Module io.winterframework.mod.configuration
Package io.winterframework.mod.configuration.source

Interface CompositeConfigurationStrategy

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultCompositeConfigurationStrategy
public interface CompositeConfigurationStrategy

A composite configuration strategy specifies what queries must be executed on the sources of a composite configuration source for an original query and what results should eventually be retained.

A composite configuration source uses a strategy as followed:

  1. for an original query, the source query which will actually be executed on a source is populated by invoking populateSourceQuery(ConfigurationKey, ConfigurationQuery, ConfigurationProperty) method, this can result in multiple queries
  2. the composite source executes the populated source query and retains the first non-empty result that supersedes current best result using the isSuperseded(ConfigurationKey, ConfigurationProperty, ConfigurationProperty) method
  3. the composite source then determined whether the result resolves the query (ie. there can't be any better result) using the isResolved(ConfigurationKey, ConfigurationProperty) method, if so, the composite source finally retains the result and does not query remaining sources for the original query.

In case of error when querying a source, the composite source can choose to ignore that error, it then considers that this particular source didn't returned any results or it can retain the faulty result which might still be superseded by next sources.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Jeremy Kuhn
See Also:
CompositeConfigurationSource.CompositeConfigurationQuery, DefaultCompositeConfigurationStrategy

  • Method Details

    • ignoreFailure

      boolean ignoreFailure​(ConfigurationSourceException error)

      Indicates whether or not the specified configuration source error should be ignored when resolving a result.

      Parameters:
      error - a configuration source error
      Returns:
      true to ignore the error, false otherwise

    • isSuperseded

      boolean isSuperseded​(ConfigurationKey queryKey, ConfigurationProperty<?,​?> previousResult, ConfigurationProperty<?,​?> result)

      Determines whether the specified result supersedes the previous result retained from previous sources for the specified original query.

      Parameters:
      queryKey - the configuration key representing the original query
      previousResult - the previous result
      result - the result to test
      Returns:
      true if the result superseds the previous result, false otherwise

    • isResolved

      boolean isResolved​(ConfigurationKey queryKey, ConfigurationProperty<?,​?> result)

      Determines whether the specified result resolves the specified original query (ie. there can't be any better result).

      Parameters:
      queryKey - the configuration key representing the original query
      result - the result to test
      Returns:
      true if the result resolves the query, false otherwise

    • populateSourceQuery

      ExecutableConfigurationQuery<?,​?,​?> populateSourceQuery​(ConfigurationKey queryKey, ConfigurationQuery<?,​?,​?> sourceQuery, ConfigurationProperty<?,​?> previousResult)

      Populates the source query created by a composite source to query one of its sources to retrieves values for the specified original query.

      This method takes the previous result retained from previous sources into account to filter out queries that can't possibly supersedes it.

      Parameters:
      queryKey - the configuration key representing the original query
      sourceQuery - the source query
      previousResult - the previous result
      Returns:
      a populated executable configuration query
